name: Eiffel Tower
description: Iconic wrought-iron lattice tower on the Champ de Mars.

name: Louvre Museum
description: World's largest art museum and a historic monument in Paris.

name: Cathédrale Notre-Dame de Paris
description: Medieval Catholic cathedral on the Île de la Cité.

name: Musée d'Orsay
description: Museum housed in the former Gare d'Orsay, a Beaux-Arts railway station.

name: Sainte-Chapelle
description: Royal chapel in the Gothic style, within the medieval Palais de la Cité.

name: Luxembourg Gardens
description: Gardens created in 1612 by Marie de' Medici, the widow of King Henry IV.

name: Tuileries Garden
description: Public garden located between the Louvre and the Place de la Concorde.

name: Shakespeare and Company
description: Iconic English-language bookstore on the Left Bank.

name: Les Deux Magots
description: Famous café in the Saint-Germain-des-Prés area of Paris.

name: Café de Flore
description: One of the oldest coffeehouses in Paris, celebrated for its famous clientele.

name: Centre Pompidou
description: Complex building in the Beaubourg area of the 4th arrondissement.

name: Sacré-Cœur Basilica
description: Roman Catholic church and minor basilica, dedicated to the Sacred Heart of Jesus.

name: Moulin Rouge
description: Cabaret in Paris, France.

name: Palace of Versailles
description: Former royal residence located in Versailles, about 12 miles west of Paris.

name: Disneyland Paris
description: Entertainment resort in Chessy, a town located 32 km (20 mi) from the centre of Paris.

name: Jardin des Plantes
description: The main botanical garden in France.

name: La Villette
description: The third-largest park in Paris, 55.5 hectares in area, located at the northeastern edge of the city.

name: Le Procope
description: The oldest café in Paris in continuous operation.

name: Musée Rodin
description: A museum that was opened in 1919, primarily dedicated to the works of the French sculptor Auguste Rodin.

name: Musée de l'Orangerie
description: An art gallery of impressionist and post-impressionist paintings located in the west corner of the Tuileries Gardens.

name: Parc des Buttes-Chaumont
description: A public park situated in northeastern Paris, France, in the 19th arrondissement.
